First, let me make a disclaimer.  I DO NOT WORK FOR RIOT. I say this because you seem to think I do, even though I don't bare the insignia, nor is my name marked in red. The last thing I want is Riot getting the impression that I am impersonating a Riot employee.

That said, let's talk about some of these examples. The guy saying "GG" and getting banned. That's usually the result of a defect in the reform card, that causes the reform card to not show all text. 1 rioter commented on this issue, saying that special characters were the cause of the incident, and later revealed the actual chat logs. Another thing, and this has been covered numerous times on this particular board, being banned is not mutually exclusive to the last game you played. As reports build up, it will eventually trigger the ban. So the guy getting banned for saying "GG" may in fact be very toxic, and the reform card chose a chat log that did not reflect his behavior properly.

Next, let's talk about your account. 4,000 games is, well, a lot of games for 1 season. While I'm not saying it's a bad thing, as I tend to grind out games every now and then, it would seem you may be destroying your own MMR. You said you dropped 2 divisions after losing promos. This is a big no no, and is a sure fire way to ruin your accounts mmr. The larger the losing streak, further your mmr plummets. If your MMR gets to low, you will notice you are playing with players far below your accounts ranking. For example, me! I'm not having the best time this preseason, and since decay is still active, I'm pressured to play in a whole new meta I haven't fleshed out yet. It's very whacky, preseason is. So because of this, I have been doing atrocious. My account has suffered from loss after loss and resulting in a negative win ratio (48%). I did eventually get demoted, but while I was still in diamond, I was consistently getting gold players on my team, while the enemy team was getting plats and diamonds. Weird, huh? It's because I tanked my mmr. 

When this happens, it's best to take a break, a week off seems to be the sweet spot for me. However, if you keep playing on and on, you're going to most certainly put your account in an extremely difficult situation to get out of. So when you're getting those really rough players, it's best to just take a small break. 

KingTyrant mentions that age affects your ban chance. This is simply not the case. You get 4 chances and that's it. If you want an example, I was chat restricted on my main. I was in good standing for 2 years after the fact! Never spoke in all chat. But one day I was having a rough one, and called someone trash. Doesn't sound to bad does it? No slurs or anything, just an argument with the worse of it being "trash". My account was permabanned a few minutes after the game. Even though I had a good track record for 2 years running. So I don't believe age actually affects your accounts standing. 

Your account holds no monetary value. Riot owns your account, and it is solely a privilege to play on that account. Because of this, you can't stake claim to the amount of money spent in the game. Especially since the game is entirely free to play outside of aesthetics,  cosmetic purposes. So bringing up how much you spent or how old your account is will not rest well with your case. 

Chat logs are only provided to benefit you as a player. Therefore, you will only see your own chat to reflect on your actions. This is because you are completely in control of what you say in chat. That is why you will never receive a chat log about your teammates. Two wrongs do not make a right. It is written in the summoners code, advising against engaging in any arguement or harrassment, regardless if it's being done to you or another player. The best course of action is to simply mute the player without saying a word to them, and report them after the game. You'd be surprised at how effective this method is. Not only does it immediately put a stop to bickering and time spent typing. It can even lead to a victory. I've seen it many of times. 

I hope you learned a lot from this thread, and the consequences of your actions. It truly is a shame to see an account like that dismissed to the void. But the bright side is, you get to have a fresh start, which means your mmr on your account will start at gold when you get to ranked, giving you the opportunity to truly display your magnificent Jhin skills. 

Good luck, Summoner!{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Sure.

Think of the behavioral system like a health bar (or tension meter) in music games. When you hit the note at an off beat,  your tension meter  increases. When you completely miss a note, the meter increases by alot. When you hit the note at good timings, it reduces the meter. 

Riot's behavior system works the same way, as in we all have a toxicity meter attached to our accounts. When players are mildly toxic, it goes up a tad. When people use hate speech, it pretty much fills up the meter. of course, clean games reduce the meter. 

Now understand that the system punishes based on consistency x severity,  meaning you can be punished for 1 game of extreme toxicity or many many games of mild severity.  

The reason why other's chat isn't shown is because Riot wants you to understand and evaluate your words alone, and not compare it to others. Other people's toxicity won't increase your toxicity meter and their toxicity will add to their toxicity meter. 

Keep in mind that it is possible for playerA to get punished and playerB not to, even though playerB was waaayyyyy more toxic . Let's say playerA started the game with the toxicity meter at 95% and playerB's at 35%. Ingame, playerB said some pretty nasty shit and playerA responds with something mild. After the game, playerA gains 10% toxicity and playerB gains 50%. Now playerA is at 105% toxicity and gets punished, whereas playerB is at 85%, and not punished in that specific game, even though playerB was found to be 5x more toxic than playerA in that game.
I'm not aware of how the system works but if it does, it would explain a lot.
